titlestmt.subtitle: University Senate Records
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Betsy Pittman.

address.addressline1: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Betsy Pittman in November 2004.

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.

did.unittitle: University of Connecticut, University Senate Records.
did.abstract: The University Senate is a legislative body responsible for establishing minimum rules and general regulations pertaining to all undergraduate schools and colleges. The collection contains the officials minutes of the organization as well as reports, studies and working materials of the Senate and its associated committees. Also included are the minutes of an earlier faculty governance and policy decision making group.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The University Senate is a legislative body responsible for establishing minimum rules and general regulations pertaining to all undergraduate schools and colleges. The Senate also is responsible for establishing general educational policy in areas not reserved to the Board of Trustees, to the administration, or to the several faculties. The Curricula and Courses Committee, a committee of the University Senate, was established in 1929.

Prior to the establishment of the University Senate, the faculty of the institution met regularly to establish and review policy, discuss issues and provide goverance for the campus academic operations.
Current information on the University Senate and its committees can be found on its website.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The records consist of minutes of meetings of the Senate and its associated committees, a variety of reports, information on new or redesigned courses and administrative files.
Also included are the minutes of the faculty, prior to the establishment of the University Senate.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I: Curricula and Courses Committee Records (undated, 1929-1989) contains the working files of the committee responsible for the approval of new courses, changes in established courses and curricula and deletion of courses no longer appropriate.
Series II: Executive Committee Records (1963-1994) contains the records of the executive committee of the organization.
Series III: Growth and Development Committee Records (1962-1985) inlcudes reports, minutes, studies and programs focused on the development of the University.

Series IV: Scholastic Standards Committee Records (1932-1981) contains information regarding the establishment of standards for evaluating students. Similar materials can be found in the records of the Committee on Degrees with Distinction for the years 1930-1948.
Series V: Other Committee Records (undated, ca. 1943-1982) inlcudes documentation created or collected by other Senate committees.
Series VI: University Senate Records (1940-2000) contains reports, minutes and some correspondence. University Senate minutes and attachments are available online from 2002 to the present.
Series VII: Faculty Meeting minutes (1893-1899) contains the minutes of the meetings of the campus faculty.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to the University's history. Recent information, reports, minutes and other relevant materials pertaining to the University Senate is available from their webpage. See also the Commission on University GovernanceCommission on University Governance Records. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: This record series is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on this collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], University of Connecticut, University Senate Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials in the collection have been transferred from the administrative offices of the University Senate to the University Archives in multiple installments since 1978.
